Presenting Complaints (Symptoms):
1. Tingling sensation in stomach
2. Palpitations
3. Trembling hands
4. Restlessness and inability to relax
History: Present history: Patient has to give presentations once a week from last from few weeks where she gets nervous. As a result, right in the beginning of her presentation she feels a tingling sensation in her stomach followed by palpitations and sweating her palms. She gets nervous and her voice starts shaking and flow of the speech gets disrupted. Right after her presentation she gets consumed by the idea that she did not deliver a quality presentation to be appreciated by her boss and that he thinks she is terrible at her job. This overall feeling makes her feel sad; Past history: Patient used to feel nervous while giving presentations in school; Family history: Patient's mother does not like to speak much in public
Current Mental Status Examination: Behavior: Patient was cordial and rapport could be established; Mood: tensed; Affect: Restricted: Thought: content- reflected worry regarding her public speaking
Issues discussed in Current Session: Patient's fear of public speaking along with her experience of giving a presentation was discussed. She has been feeling anxious before and while giving a presentation followed by a feeling of sadness due to the thoughts of scrutiny by her boss. Her mother has also been less vocal when it comes to public speaking. Patient experiences a tingling sensation in her stomach, palpitations, trembling hands and an inability to feel relaxed.
